author: {'steamid': '76561198069543160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1615713487}
review:
This isn't a game you play through and then put it away. This game isn't a game you play in 3 hour sessions.

Instead it is fun in 5-10 minute intervals.

And, oh my, fun it is. It is perfectly designed, not too easy, not too frustrating, easy to understand but with strategic depth. 

For example the bombs, you get bombs by building up a multiplier, but they destroy a big portion of the screen instantly, you can't sustain the multiplier if you there aren't any enemies you can destroy. And yet again you need the bombs to survive. You can also chain multiple bombs for a enormous multiplier, because the bomb can destroy enough enemies to give you a second bomb, but to get really the most of that you need to be careful about keeping certain enemies alive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045370334', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1474697725}
review:
What the description says: In Waves, play as an anti-viral cell in a Neo-Cyberspace arena while your system is being overrun by bugs, errors and viruses and the only solution is to kill every rogue process before it kills you.

What the game feels like: In Waves, play as an MDMA molecule in a Digital Electronica club version of your brain while your mind is being overrun by feelings of sadness, confusion and reality and the only solution is to kill every inkling of the comedown before re-upping. 

+ Awesome twin-stick shooter
+ Bumping soundtrack
+ Intense graphics
+ Enemies exhibit a variety of maneuvers
+ Plenty of modes to choose from
+ Easy to play in short bursts
+ Challenge increases the more you play

- Multiplier system can be hard to climb
- Repetitive, but that's what the different modes are for
- Local or online co-op would be magical

Easily worth the price for the amount of gameplay available. 

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044406862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1655498485}
review:
I've played this game way more than a few times, and i'll try to be as serious as i can in this review.

Pros
- Colorful graphics.
- Simple to learn.
- Nice soundtrack, also available as DLC to purchase.
- Several different enemies, including static ones.
- Different game modes.

Cons
- Some users have issues with starting the game.
- Gameplay can be repetitive, even in the same run.

After all, i can say that the cons are nothing compared to the pros, and it's a really nice game to pass some time.
Totally worth it's cost, i rate it 9/10 if you like the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059530951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1429682191}
review:
Waves est un petit jeu d'arcade trÃ¨s sympathique oÃ¹ le seul est unique objectif est de faire le plus gros score et ce, quel que soit le mode choisi parmi les sept proposÃ©s. Dans la mÃªme veine que son excellent aÃ®nÃ© Geometry Wars, vous incarnez une boule qui doit survivre, au sein d'une arÃ¨ne dÃ©limitÃ©e, aux vagues d'assauts ennemis. Les ennemis Ã©tant, tout comme dans le jeu prÃ©cÃ©demment citÃ©, des formes gÃ©omÃ©triques aux couleurs et aux comportements variables. Par exemple : les sphÃ¨re rose se dÃ©place lentement et alÃ©atoirement ; les sphÃ¨res rouges sont rapides et vont tout droit d'une extrÃ©mitÃ© Ã  l'autre de l'arÃ¨ne ; les sphÃ¨res jaunes vous suivent constamment, les vertes vous suivent mais fuient dÃ¨s que vous allez dans leur direction etc. Tout l'intÃ©rÃªt du gameplay, qui se joue ici Ã  la manette avec les deux joystick (l'un pour tirer l'autre pour se dÃ©placer), est de survivre Ã  ces vagues ininterrompus d'ennemis toujours plus nombreux pour ainsi faire le meilleur score. Il est important de toujours se dÃ©placer, d'esquiver, de contourner et surtout, de ramasser l'expÃ©rience laissÃ©e par vos ennemis afin de monter en niveau. Lorsque vous passez un level, vous augmentez votre multiplicateur de point et de fait, votre score. La partie la plus subtile et la spÃ©cificitÃ© de Waves, c'est la capacitÃ© de votre boule Ã  gÃ©nÃ©rer une bombe dÃ¨s que vous atteignez un streak de dix ennemis tuÃ©s. Cette bombe permet d'anÃ©antir tous les ennemis autour de vous et se trouvant Ã  une portÃ©e moyenne. IdÃ©al de cultiver son streak pour se sortir des situations pÃ©rilleuses ! Enfin, vous pouvez Ã©galement, grÃ¢ce Ã  l'une des gÃ¢chettes du pad, ralentir le temps pendant un temps limitÃ© afin de vous frayer un chemin parmi ce joyeux bordel ambiant ! GÃ©nial !
Les graphismes sont simples mais efficaces, toutefois j'ai prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© l'univers visuel de Geometry Wars, plus prÃ©gnant, mÃªme si finalement les deux se ressemblent beaucoup. En revanche, l'ambiance sonore est nulle Ã  chier ! Quel gÃ¢chis ! La plupart du temps, les musiques sont discrÃ¨tes voire inexistantes ! Et les quelques musiques electro un peu pÃªchues sont trÃ¨s dÃ©cevantes. Gros point noir pour Waves. Une musique entraÃ®nante est indispensable dans les jeux arcade de ce type. On regrettera aussi le fait qu'il n'y ait qu'un seul mode d'arme, contrairement Ã  son aÃ®nÃ© qui en proposait plusieurs. Mais dans l'ensemble Waves parvient Ã  l'essentiel : se rendre addictif et fun !

author: {'steamid': '76561198141957545', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1661602165}
review:
Pros:
Pretty damn fun.
Feels difficult, but generally without feeling unfair.
Looks cool.
Controller support is great, best way to play.

Cons:
No rebinding. I'd like to bind the bomb and slomo buttons to the buttons instead of the triggers, but I can't.
A few of the game modes feel a little unnecessary.
Should probably have some kind of gun upgrades or something, it'd spice the game up and give it a lot more replay value, without it, this game gets old a lot faster than other similar games.
Pausing is really funky. You can't pause while you're respawning, a process that takes like 5 seconds, an annoyingly long time if you've gotten a bad start to survival mode or something and just wanna restart. And to further the frustration, the menu takes a little too long to come up, and if you're trying to pause in a hurry and aren't sure it came up, you may accidentally unpause it by hitting it again. In a fast-paced game like this, pauses NEED to be instantaneous, nothing feels worse than dying because you were trying to pause.

But, it's $5, which ain't too bad, so unless any of those things are a dealbreaker, I still recommend it. Good few hours of fun to be had here. If they add more weapons/guns/bullets or whatever, and maybe some gamemodes that aren't just bouncing around a circle, like an actual map, then it's a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964864960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1429858014}
review:
First thing you'll notice with this game is the need to turn off all bloom, effects, and everything, so you can see what the heck is going on. Second thing will be the terrible controls. Third thing will be how utterly random everything seems to be (what enemies spawn when, where, and everything in between).

Add to that how the game will berate, or downright insult you when it thinks you're not using the stupid "slowmo" that gets you killed more often than it saves you (because making things slower won't change the bad controls or how much inertia they decided the game needed) often enough, and quite frankly, I really can't recommend this exercise in frustration.

I'm sure I could get better with more practice. I'm also sure it wouldn't be particularly fun to do so.

review:
Very addictive twin stick shooter. Game design is superb, rewarding hair-raising risk-taking to acheive the really  big points. I haven't experienced that "one more play" feeling for a considerable period of time. The mechanics are beautifully tuned and the numerous game modes will take a long time to master. 

Brilliant game. If you like twin stick shooters this might float your boat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027304457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1431024141}
review: Waves is a modern take on the classic space shooter arcade games of the 80's. In Waves you'll find that the controls are very easy to pick up and that the gameplay has a nice casual feel to it. The graphics and colors in Waves give it a fun and attractive look/feel. With each level of Waves comes more challenging enemies charging at you, more bright explosions, and more intensity to the gameplay; all the while maintaining a simple core concept of flying around shooting enemies in outter space. A few other nice things about Waves are: a fun sountrack, bits of humor hidden in the game, a handful of different game modes, and loads of steam achievements. I'd highly recommend this game to fans of twin-stick shooters or to those looking for a fun game that can easily be picked up for a few minutes at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091388279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1584292442}
review:
God help you. God help you all. That drug addiction you kicked? A nervous tic. If your friends describe you as the poster child for addictive personalities, then just click away and save yourself the glorious, swarming, bullet-hell-esque heart ache.

I won't keep hitting you with vague hyperboles, but you need to check this out while getting it is easy. The value you're getting out of this game for $0.99 is stupid. It's simple, but visually it's surprisingly attractive, and there are several game modes to suit your play style. Perhaps the most accurate way I can paint an image for you is by drawing a parallel with Super Meatboy. It's lacks any sort of story depth that Super Meatboy may have, but it has that same lightning-fast, razor's edge pace that demands every ounce of attention you can possibly wring from your brain. That exhilerating feeling of only barely being able to keep up, and the highly rewarding feeling of pulling of a sick run.

Minimal, highly arcade, highly retro with cutting-edge PhysX graphics. Get this while it's on sale. Seriously. There is not another game on Steam as of this date that is a better buy for $0.99. If you're reading this later, I feel like it may well be worth the regular $5.00 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064530048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1480779504}
review:
I brought the game because it was cheap on a sale (79p), but it's actually a really good game!

It's an arcade style twin stick shooter. I really like the neon-looking style to fit with the theme of Cyberspace and errors & viruses overrunning the arena. The main objective in most modes is to last as long as you can and shoot your way through the waves of enemies, with each wave getting progressively harder. There are different coloured bugs which overrun the arena, each with a different movement pattern and there is also a virus of hexagons which grows over time filling the arena. These viruses are good for shooting to obtain a "bomb" which you can use by hitting the space bar, but if you wait too long it will wear off and you won't be able to use it.

I love the "Bombing Run" mode, where you can't shoot at all but you have to roll and dodge enemies while going from red hexagons to green hexagons to set off a bomb, killing enemies near you. The dodging enemies can require some good skills but you also get a shield every so often to help protect you, the shield basically pushes enemies back if they hit you for a short amount of time acting like a instant second life.

Also - Achievements! ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198077246586', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1453036127}
review: OK, here is the test for whether you should get this game. Go play some free twin-stick shooter, like Echoes. Did you like it? Then you're going to fucking love this game. The controls are awesome and tight. The enemies are all interesting and unique. But the coolest part is the mechanics. The 4 moves are: Move, shoot, bomb, and slow down time. The first two are self explanitary, after a ten hit combo you have a second to activate a bomb, and you slowly charge a buffer, that can slow down time and get you double points while you do so 'because it looks awesome'. Oh, and you also get double points for shooting enemies at point blank 'because it looks awesome'. This game is awesome.

review:

Le menu du jeu rame sur mon PC (qui fait tourner n'importe quel jeu avec les paramÃ¨tres graphiques au max). 
L'univers du jeu essaie de vous draguer en utilisant une voix robotique Ã  la portal et plein d'effets visuels de flou ou de distorsion surchargÃ©s. C'est uniquement pour cacher l'unique arÃ¨ne de jeu (un bÃªte cercle minusculaire) et le faible nombre d'ennemis (des boules de plusieurs couleurs, des cubes faisant office de boss et des hexagones qui s'Ã©tendent lentement pour former une espÃ¨ce de mousse). 
On contrÃ´le une boule qui tirer des lasers, fait Ã©clater des bomes et peut activer des ralentis. Il n'y a pas de possibilitÃ© d'amÃ©lioration.
Le plus gros problÃ¨me lÃ -dedans c'est qu'on s'ennuie trÃ¨s vite, et que la rejouabilitÃ© est quasi-nulle, ce qui est un gros dÃ©faut pour ce type de jeu.

Beat Harzard est bien plus intÃ©ressant Ã  ce niveau, et aussi bien plus fun. Il n'en fait pas des tonnes pour essayer de nous impressionner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067952614', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1651565426}
review:
[h1] Waves Review - Ace Elite [/h1]

Waves is a fantastice arcade twin-stick shooter, perfect for wasting that 10 minuetes you don't know what do do with you life on. Or 30 mins. Or 2 hours, Like me.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Waves controls extremely well, with a controller or not. You play as a ball, and your aim is pretty much to blow up everything in the arena to earn XP, to earn multipliers, to earn points. This ball that you play as has a couple of tricks up it's sleeve though, the first is the ability to slow down time, and the second is, after you reach a combo of 10, you can let off this  explosion killing everything within a small area. The scoreboard in this game is amazing, it clearly and neatly displays your friends high scores as well as your own when you end the game. It even displays  your friends high scores during the game to the right of the screen. This suprisingly doesn't interrupt gameplay at all. The game has several modes, Including: Crunch Time, Survival, Rush, Bombing Run, Challenge, Chase and Hold. Survival, which I would say is the main mode here, as it is just classic roll around and kill everything, you have 3 lives and unlimited time to post the best score and every 10 levels, you gain an extra life, in Rush, you have 2 minutes to earn points, and every time you die you lose 10 seconds from your time, Crunch Time throws you into the arena with infinite lives and 3 minutes to just have fun, and that is what you do in this mode, have fun, in Hold mode, you have 3 lives and have to to stay within a circle of light as it floats around the arena,you have to stay inside this as your guns won't work outside of it, Chase is an insane mode where you have 5 seconds to roll over to these red pads, which re-news your five seconds to live, Challenge mode gives you 20 waves of enemies, and 30 seconds to complete each one. Completeing the challenges, (doing it within an amount of time and stuff like that) will award you bonus points, finally there is Bombing Run, which  dissables your guns, and throws down these red pads, you then need to roll over them to pick up the bomb and then go to the green pad before the bomb explodes, when you get the bomb on the green pad, it explodes killing everything. Except you. 

[h1] Prettyness (or graphics/presentation) [/h1]

Waves has an awesome art style, everything is very crisp and works well together with the amazing neon glow of everything. Sometimes the screen can get a bit crowded, but this isn't too bad.

[h1] Sounds/Music [/h1]

Waves has an amazing sound track wich fits in perfectly in the background of all this caos. there is also a nice robotic lady-like voice that tells you when your bomb is ready and stuff like that.

[h1] Verdict [/h1]

This is a fantastic game for just 5 bucks considering the amount of content. I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys, um, explosions, guns, balls, cool music and robot voices :).

Thanks for reading this!

TL;DR
Has explosions and guns.
Nuff said.

review: Waves ist ein Arcade-Spiel mit einigen verschiedenen Modi, die jeweils gut entwickelt worden sind und SpaÃŸ machen. Z.B. kann man in einem "Bomben" Modus nicht schieÃŸen, sondern muss sich von Bombenfeld zu Bombenfeld bewegen, um Bomben, die die Gegner zerstÃ¶ren, zu aktivieren, wÃ¤hrend man im Survival Modus die Gegner erschieÃŸen muss. Jedoch geht es im gesamten Spiel darum, sich von den Kugel-,WÃ¼rfel- und FeldfÃ¶rmigen Gegnern sich nicht zu berÃ¼hren lassen, um gegebene Leben oder Zeit zu behalten, und diese fÃ¼r Punkte zu zerstÃ¶ren, wobei die Slow-Motion-Funktion in jedem Modus benutzbar ist. Der Preis von 4,99â‚¬ ist nicht zu hoch gesetzt, wenn man solche "Spielautomaten-Spiele" mag. Wenn man aber nur ein Gelegenheitsspiel sucht, sollte man auf einen Sale warten.

review: This game reminds me of an old Mac game, the title of which escapes me right now, but maybe Dr. Z? Either way, you operated as a lone survivor in a room and had to kill off wave after wave of zombies. it was simple, but addicting. Waves takes that theme to another level by adding a variety of enemy types and what I assume is predictive 'boss' group spawns depending on how much you move around. It will also destroy your WASD keys and give you multiple heart conditions. 10/10 would recommend.

review: Considering i bought this game for $1, I'd say its okay. Ive played much better games of this style, but its hard to beat the price. I dont play it that much because i get bored about 7 minutes in, as theres no upgrades in weaponry at all. I still don't know the purpose for levelling up. I'm on the fence with this one, just because it was so cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068802071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1423341790}
review:
This game is only good if you can buy it for less than the price of geometry wars: retro evolved. GW:RE outclasses it in so many different ways: better bomb system, better combo system, and better enemies; but, the problems that this game has can be easily fixed with one or two balance patches, but the devs seem to want to use their time putting in community reccomendations for game modes and shit instead of fixing these. 

Some specific gripes:

Bombs are terrible. They are never usefull when you can get them, unless you can kill a bunch of virus in a small period of time, because the enemies that you killed to get the combo to get the bomb were probably all the enemies in the bomb's radius. 

Enemies are unbalanced. The clustery things that turn red when you shoot them are a direct upgrade from the 3 little ball things, but they sacrifice speed for survivability: this means that it takes so much more effort to kill them than it does to kill literally any other enemy other than cubes. The green ball things that dodge your bullets are absolute bullshit; you could be in a perfectly fine position, then 4 or 5 of these fuckers spawn in, and suddenly you have to use all of your slowmo to kill each of them individually, and if you miss, you have to resort to killing them outside of slowmo, which poses the same problem as the clustery things- you're using more and more effort to kill something that shouldn't take that much. 

Enemies use too much rng to spawn. Enemies in this game spawn in seemingly completely random patterns, and take .5-1 seconds to spawn; this means that if you're being overwhelmed in a game and one or two dudes spawn right next to you, you either have to use your slowmo to move out of there, or you instantly die, and you've probably already used your slowmo to survive being overwhelmed. 

Cubes have too much health for their size and impact on the game. The cubes in this seem good on paper, but when implemented, are absolutely fucking broke as shit in practice. They have the same problem as those other ones I put down, with taking too much effort to kill, exept these ones seriously punish you for not having the answer to them right when they come into play; they need to spawn in when you're in a position to get a bomb fast, otherwise you have this huge death-square coming for you and you can't deal with it without leaving every other enemy unattended. 

The combo system is trying too hard to be original. Honestly this part could be very easily fixed if the devs understood why most games use either the 'combo is constantly going up as you kill enemies and resets when you die or something' system or the 'combo goes up pretty fast but instantly goes away in a small period of time after you don't kill something' system. The system that waves uses is trying to make the latter better, but fails miserably: you need to kill 3 enemies to get one stack, and that will only happen when you're being overwhelmed by enemies or during an ambush of like 10 dudes. It rewards you for being in situations any sane person shouldn't be putting themselves in, which results in you needing to be lucky/really really good at twin stick shooters to get high scores in survival. 

The challange mode is absolutely infuriating for completionists. Not being able to go in and pick which levels you want to do and not do is just fucking terrible. Having to do that one level that you always fuck up on when you're doing great in one challange run makes me want to stop playing this. 

TL;DR: This game is poorly designed and needs balance changes and you shouldn't buy it until the devs fix what I've complained about. 3/10 outclassed by geometry wars in almost every way.

Edit: the music is pretty ehh as well, thought I should mention it; easily fixed by turning it off and turning on your own music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102429531', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1466021460}
review:
In this game, you can realise your fantasy of being a giant ball that shoots pellets. I know I did. I reccomend you buy this game on sale; I got it for a little under a quid, which is neato.

PROS:
- Simple gameplay
- Great music
- Varied enemies
- Awesome controller support
- Witty menu text.

CONS:
- Not really any cons, but the shooting can be a little finicky at times.


Graphics: 10/10
Sound + Music: 10/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Story: n/a

author: {'steamid': '76561198022636031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1475133147}
review: I quickly grew to like this game and the subtle variations in play modes.  The scoring is well done and visually its appealing.  The ample number of achievements have been satisfying to complete.  The interface allows for easy navigation and there are plenty of options.  One minor omission is the inclusion of auto-fire, especially since there is no restriction on the amount of ammunition shot.  I have no major complaints with the game itself however it does leave me with cramps from the rapid mouse movements needed to spray the hordes of nasties. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025332498', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1475847229}
review:
Waves is a twin stick shooter that cost be 99 cents, and it was worth so much more. A simply and very well designed game Waves has you moving and shooting in all directions to destroy brightly coloured balls and shapes. There are a variety of game modes which are all fun and engaging, my personal favourite being Challenge, Survival and Bomb Run. This game is very hard in stages but itâ€™s never frustrating, if you die itâ€™s your fault, not hardware, making you even more determined to beat your last high score, or the scores of your friends. Not to mention the dry wit and humor in the instructions and end game screens is hilarious and well worth a few dollars. If you can get a few friends to play against even more so. 

The visuals, music and gameplay are spot on and it's a great little time sink that I highly reccomend. 

A word of warning however, this game is MUCH easier and fun with a controler, rather than a keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016635124', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1421805594}
review:
If you're a fan of dual stick shooters already, waves is a very solid one. The gimmick here is that you can slow down time when you've charged up your meter enough, and this simple but satisfying mechanic really is enough to make it stand out. The avatar also has a bit of momentum to it, making it feel a bit different to control than other shooters.

Honestly, there isn't much to say. You probably already know if you like this style of game. It's fast-paced arcade action with replay value for as long as you can entertain yourself beating your own high scores. If you're looking for an exciting, flashy game to keep you entertained for a week or two, Waves is a pretty fantastic deal.

review:
This game has all the right junk in all the right places.

But seriously, its a highly polished little shooter with great gameplay and suprising satisfaction.

I also own Beat Hazard, AudioSurf 2 and Geometry Wars 3 - and I would have to say that Waves is my favourite in the genre.

The only thing I find a bit lacking is the no MP.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998716508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1420639493}
review:
Twin joystick shooters tend not to be for me, but I find myself enjoying this game a lot. The game feel is dead on and there's some real momentum to contend with. The player's weapon never changes (I think) and the survival mode is all I want it to be really.

I don't find myself getting into the other modes of play, but they're there if you want them. I'll probably update this review as I play the game more, but if you want something with good game feel and a good few songs then this is a pretty solid $5.00 to spend. I'd wait for it to be on sale or a bundle though. There are other games like this with more content out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120876870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1447211985}
review: Strategy + Sarcasm + Shapes = Waves

author: {'steamid': '76561197978705200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1417467634}
review:
This game is essentially Geometric Battles 2. If you're looking for a quality twin-stick shooter, and you're sick of having so much free-time, then give this a look.

PLOT: Roll around, shoot stuff, and don't die.
While there are seven modes of play, there are some constants to be aware of. Waves emphasizes the multiplier-system. Every-time you level-up, a multiplier bonus appears on the field. Scores tend to be very top-heavy, the longer you survive, the better your score. However, by playing risky and using the limited slowmo ability, you can tack on another 4X bonus to every shape you destroy. Early on that doesn't mean much, but earning a 60X bonus by level 15 can be very nice. It also pays to keep combos going, because for every 10 shapes, you get a temporary bomb. For most modes, an extra-life is awarded every 10 levels.

Crunch Time - You have three minutes to get a high-score. Since time is limited, this mode revolves around maximising the slow-down ability. This is a good mode, especially when you want to play a videogame, but only have a few minutes.

Survival - Self-explanatory. You're given a stock of lives and you have to go as long as possible. Every several seconds a wave of enemies surrounds you, which can mix things up a bit.

Rush - You're under a time-limit, with extra seconds only awarded through level-ups and destroying cubes. My strategy consists of moving in circles, only going for the multipliers if I bomb through the hordes. Honestly, I think I play it a little too safe, and my score tends to suffer as a result.

Bombing Run - No weapons and you have to keep grabbing and exploding bombs to destroy enemies and survive. Your only other means of defense is a shield. It recharges quickly when the action is hectic, but only activates once. I really enjoy this mode, because is focuses on almost entirely on proper maneuvering. 

Challenge - Destroy enemies as quickly as possible, get a high multiplier, achieve ratings of up to five stars. This mode consists of 20 stages. It's alright, if you're looking for something a bit more concise. The challenges have specific tactics so you're employing more thought into the game aside from: "I better not run into this shape!"

Chase - You have about five seconds to move from point to point while destroying shapes. I guess this mode is directed at guys like me who prefer to play the wall and take it easy. Due to the ultra-stringent time-limit, things will get extremely intense. It's easy to fall into despair, when you have only a second left, and a thick crowd of enemies have blocked off the next point.

Hold - You can only fire while in the lit-area. Keep in mind that this is a tight-space to be confined to. You might even have to leave the lit-area just to lure shapes out of your personal space. Those precious multiplier bonuses tend to spawn outside as well. This is a tough mode to play, simply due to how claustrophobic it is. I don't really care for it.

While getting overwhelmed in this game is a constant, what actually kills you is usually the one shape that gets away. You're circling around, firing at a huge mass of shapes, but you're not looking at where you're moving to. Guess what happens next? An enemy spawns in your face and you die. Maybe that one shape matrix-dodges your bullets somehow. Yes the game can throw so many shapes on-screen that it'll cause your $1000 PC to freak out, but what kills you? That one shape. I shouldn't have to say this, but focus is the key. If you're distracted for 1/120000th of a second, you're done for.

Like its inspiration, Waves has really good leaderboard support. If you have a lot of friends that play this game, all the better. The score of the next person ahead of you is always on display, giving you an incentive to work harder. 

There's not much else to say really, you probably already own this game(via an indie bundle), but ignored it due its generic title. Definitely give this game a look, you'll likely have a lot of trouble putting it down though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991625636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1541399203}
review: Bitchin soundtrack and some great mechanics. Seeing how far you can push your combos feels great, and the alternate modes offer some satisfying spins on the traditional challenge. I was personally very motivated by the leaderboards and trying to catch up to friends' scores. If you like twin-stick shooters, definitely give this one a spin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016874288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1526324885}
review: This game is awesome. It's cheap and so worth it. The game is trippy so don't buy this if you can't handle it. author: {'steamid': '76561198006230348', 'num_games_owned': 1069, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1668495436}
review: The developer has known about a crashing on startup issue for a while and hasn't fixed it, what a shame. Was nice that they pinned a how to fix thread to the community discussions page nearly TWO YEARS AGO (January of 2013), but the link to a fixed version of PhysX is now dead!  At a loss, I uninstalled PhysX as another discussion thread suggested, no avail.. Until this is fixed, this review will stay negative as a warning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011289000', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1626803337}
review:
A decent and rather unique twin stick game.

It's bomb dynamic is an innovative twist on an old format, learning to chain them in combination with your slow-mo ability is the key to success and it's both original and refreshing!

Visually it's OK and I like the short written verdict on your performance after each game.

I do find that the inertia based player movement is overly sluggish when changing direction, it works in slow-mo but is a frequent cause of death at normal speed even though you can clearly see in advance what you would like to dodge.

Challenge mode could do with re-balancing as some stages are far more difficult than others with no information regarding what's needed to achieve a better rating. 

Overall it's worthy of a place in any twin stick fans collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982225800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1379646708}
review:
I wrote my opinion on this game in a forum post well-before reviews were added to Steam, so I'll just copy-and-paste it here:


Well, Waves is a dual-stick shooter that is aesthetically similar to Geometry Wars 2, but that's about it.

I'll sum-up what I think the main differences are:

[list]
[*]The ship in Waves has weight to it (unlike GW 1 & 2), so you can't just turn on a dime.
[*]You can slow-down time (which also grants you a point-bonus per enemy you kill while in slow-mo). This ability recharges at a decent pace.
[*]You have bombs, but they works rather differently: When you get a combo of 10 kills, you can use a bomb (you lose it if you lose your combo, though). As you can imagine, there can be a lot of enemies on screen, so getting a 10x combo is mind-numbingly easy to do again and again.
[*]There is a Level & Experience system, which is used to scale-up the difficulty for a particular play-session. I find it adds absolutely nothing to the game, and there's no reason to even pay attention to it as you're playing.
[/list]

That said, you can basically play it with your brain off by just going around in circles, and spamming bombs over and over again because of how quick/easy it is to constantly get 10x combos. And not long into a session, there'll be enough enemies to constantly net you those 10x combos that it won't even matter what direction you shoot in anymore.

At least, that was my experience playing it the other day, which was the first time in just under one year. I only played the main mode during that session (Survival mode), and on my very first try, got the achievement for attaining the highest score possible. So all Waves left me with was a main game mode that was way too easy to top-out, and a few other game-modes which I distinctly remember not liking very much.

So yeah, I feel that those looking for a Geometry Wars fix will find Waves somewhat disappointing. It's not a bad game at all, and might even be a decent distraction if you could get it really cheap, but it left me feeling really underwhelmed - both a year ago, and when I picked it up again the other day.

[b]Edit:[/b] I made a silly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1415243664}
review:
Rating 9/10
Overview: Twin Stick Arena Shooter

The Good:

+The game has an interesting premise. Killing enemies levels you up. Upon leveling, a score multiplier is randomly placed in the arena. Collecting this increases your multiplier by 1 permanently. Killing lots and lots of enemies in a short period of time also increases your combo meter. When your meter reaches 10 you get to drop a bomb that kills enemies in the surrounding area. You can also slow down time for a brief period if this get a bit too crazy. You add all of this together and you get a fun fast shooter .

+ The game has plenty of interesting modes to keep you engaged. Each mode is vastly different from the last and offers plenty of different ways to play the game. 

+Great music

+ This game is the definition of pick up and play if you are looking to kill some time. Lots of replayability

The Bad:

- Some achievements are very hard to get 

- Can be frustrating at times

Conclusion

Considering I got this game for one dollar, it probably is one of the better purchases I've made. If you love the genre then this is a fantastic game to add to your library. If your just a casual fan like myself then you will also find it enjoyable.

review: I feel this game is perfect for Pick-up-and-plays before work or as a reward for studying in the Crunch Time mode but is also an enjoyable progression curve for durational play. The soundtrack is active and the gameplay sucks you in. I love playing this game once a day so far!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027086818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1478041106}
review:
A hectic and vibrant twin-stick arena-based shooter that delivers. 

The Good:
- Includes several different unique game modes, which each provide their own challenges, and each are even entertaining in their own right.
- The graphics are lively and vibrant, and add to the feeling of the overwhelming odds stacked against you.
- The bomb mechanic is excellent.  I get chills thinking about times I cleared the arena with 3 consecutive bombs strikes just as i was getting overrun.
- Has a good variety of distinguishable enemies, and the slowly-growing "virus" is a wonderful touch that allows you to turn an encroaching foe into an arena-clearing weapon.
- I think the music is good. Honestly I can't remember it.
- The game has the derisive sense of humor of an older brother.
- It's made by a studio called Squid in a Box, which might be the best studio name ever.
- The game menus are succinct, fast, and well-designed.

The Bad:
- With everything going on around you and the colorful graphical effects it's easy to lose track of what's going on. 
- The leaderboards seem hacked.  Everyone in the top 10 or whatever has the exact same astronomical score.
- Some people might be turned off by the pace of this game. 

Overall I recommend this game, especially if you like fast-paced arcade-style shooters where you die a lot but occasionally have those epic runs you want to tell you friends about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043428371', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1549163719}
review:
This is the kind of game that when you lose you say "Ok, I'm gonna play just one more..." and then you wake up 3 days later totally wasted with you controller crashed against the wall and all you can see is colorful dots flying around your vision. Seriously, this game is a challenge that makes you keep trying to best yourself even though you know that, by the end, the game always wins.

It's fun, it's cheap, it has a high replayability factor and don't let me get started with the sarcastic jokes all around the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969730757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1412545026}
review:
If you like twin-stick shooters (keyboard+mouse is actually more fun) and/or score attack, this is a definite recommendation.
I like neither. ... I likeD neither. Then I got Waves. ^^

Upsides:
- Launches quickly without forcing you to sit through endless logos. (Two skippables, and if you rename the video files, you get undelayed launch.)
- Many different game modes that all utilize, hone and broaden the basic skillset of the player.
- Good music.
- Some peculiar, moderate humor that is almost like a sports coach at times.
- Plenty of achievement goals.

Generally very motivating. Many details I cannot put into words. The whole package just is a lot of fun.
And, hell, it has a demo! You can check for yourself! Yay!

Downsides:
- You can't choose which music plays.
- Maybe some minor obstacles when using a game controller for menu navigation.
- Leaderboard display tediously slow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054646614', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1548265108}
review:
Waves is one those indie games i've never heard or seen before but beats some AAA titles despite being simple.

Things I liked:
+Graphics
Shiny, coulorfull and eye catching

+Gameplay
Has many game modes to keep you entertained

+Soundtrack
Motives you to play and it gives a nice touch to the game

+Scores
You can compare scores with other players in the world


Things i didn't liked
-My right arm hurts. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198048965861', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1526983994}
review:
The ball who shoots other balls
This has to be one of the best game you can play when you got nothing to do.
This is not really a game that i would sit and play for hours more like minutes every now and then

Standard Rules: If any of the balls touches you, you die so that's why you have lasers to shoot them before they touch you because they charge you like bulls.

The map or whatever is circular and the balls spawns randomly and you can ofcourse you move around to dodge and shoot.

There are high scores in the game that you always try to beat
It's really fun and there's many different game modes but one thing for sure, the action never ends!
It's everything to survival and different challenges and the soundtracks are awesome!
It even got one of those sweet GLaDOS voices! Like cmon buy it already!

This game is really worth the money, I would buy it again.

rating 7.5/10 - â˜  Pirate â˜

author: {'steamid': '76561198013026902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1652231629}
review: "Connection lost!" has become one of my least favorite phrases!  Great game though...tons of different play modes.  Easy to learn, hard to master.  Challenging and addicting, for me anyway.  Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063392860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1532811087}
review: Waves has a surprising number of different gaming modes.  Only after playing it for a few days, I have my favorites and find the entire game quite addicting.  The more I play, the better I get and the more I want to play.  I have a controller and find the controls very smooth.  The in game tools at your disposal are limited (Slow-Mo and bomb), but are very useful and affective.  Both have saved my life numerous times.  As you level up, you have a chance to get a score multiplier.  I really hate when it disappears before I can grab it, but it does add some difficulty to the game.  I purchased this game when it was on sale, but it's definately worth the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029352134', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1477224263}
review:
How-To-Play Section alone makes this game worth it.

This game is hard as hell and also addicting, But there are only few soundtrack in the game and I personally think its fcking suck! Theres a music that is too loud and theres some that is almost non existant (humming ambience). Playing third party music in the background is highly recommended.

8/10 Great time killer, When theres nothing better to do. I'm occupied most of the time so I dont get to play it alot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049074503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1704577498}
review:
Sencillo y entretenido, deudor del Geometry Wars (las similitudes son evidentes), algo mÃ¡s 'descafeinado', y con un Ãºnico escenario que en algunos momentos se queda pequeÃ±o, pero que funciona perfectamente para todos los modos que el juego ofrece (Prueba de tiempo, supervivencia, retos, bomba, etc).

La banda sonora es correcta, disfrutable y que acompaÃ±a bastante bien durante las partidas (en otros juegos del mismo estilo llega a ser muy pesada la mÃºsica), y el aspecto grÃ¡fico igual, las explosiones y brillos de los enemigos al destruirlos no estorban ni complican la visiÃ³n del resto del escenario (en juegos como Beat Hazard no consigues ver nada y eso dificulta la jugabilidad y el disfrute).

En resumen, un juego correcto dentro de este estilo, quizÃ¡s no tan destacable como otros mÃ¡s populares, pero entretenido para pasar un rato y desconectar, que merece la pena de oferta para los amantes de este estilo de juegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967779846', 'num_games_owned': 1256, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1450850145}
review: Totally scratches that twin stick, top down shooter itch on PC. Highly addictive. Great soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977567326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1411936135}
review:
Okay, this is nothing short of amazing.  It's a Williams game - Defender, Tempest, Robotron 2084.  It's pure evil, and it wants to hurt you.  Probably laugh while it's doing it, too.

Gorgeous graphics, an excellent selection of very different gameplay modes (an unexpected and very welcome touch!).  This has one-more-go hard-wired into its DNA.  It's brutally addictive.

The graphics, though lush and lovely, never get in the way of what's going on.  The colours do trick you sometimes.  You think you're heading for a green bomb pad, but no, it's a virus cluster of nearly the same shade.

Slo-mo helps, but is in short supply.  The bomb mechanic takes some getting used to and doesn't always work.  One time, the voice started saying 'Bomb ready', but the combo had dropped (and with it, the bomb) before she'd even said the two words.

I paid 79p for this game.  Honestly, if that decimal place had been moved two places to the right, I still would have thought I got a brilliant bargain.

Can't recommend it highly enough.

review:
Nos encontramos ante un juego para pasar el rato pero que nos ofrece algun reto.

El juego es una copia casi exacta del fabuloso Geometry wars 2, solo que sin multijugador.

Si te gustan este tipos de juegos adelante, es entretenido. Pero pagar mas de 2â‚¬ por el es demasiado, por eso esperad a las ofertas.

P.D.: La musica no llega al nivel del Geometry wars, pero bueno, se deja escuchar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969425957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1362902400}
review: An excellent game in the vein of Robotron and Geometry Wars. The gameplay is great and slowly ramps up to give you a chance to learn how to best approach each of the enemy types you face. It has a great feel with points, powerups, and bombs. Check it out if you have any interest in the aforementioned games, because this is well worth the price (at $0.99 at time of writing).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998296277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1411065997}
review:
This game rips off quite a lot  from Geometry Wars, but I wouldn't say that's inherently a bad thing. Geometry Wars is a damn good game, and honestly I think Waves is a far better game.

A lot of that sentiment comes from how Waves differs from Geometry Wars in terms of its more nuanced mechanics. While both are minimalist twin-stick shooters with similar art directions (though not identical, since Waves uses 3D models), Waves and Geometry Wars have fairly different ways in which they handle their score multipliers and bombs. Waves also has a bullet-time mechanic that's based on a meter you fill as you destroy enemies, and enemies you kill while slowed down net you a point bonus. You can also get point bonuses from destroying enemies at point blank, in which you have a circle around your ship that shows you the radius enemy ships have to be within in order to get the point blank bonus. Overall I just prefer the mechanics in Waves over Geometry Wars.

I haven't played Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved 2, but from what I've read about it Waves it at least on par as they both offer a good handful of game modes that the original game does not have. Some modes in Waves are pretty much identical to ones in Retro Evolved 2 (Waves' "Crunch Time" and RE2's "Deadline" operate on the same principle of scoring as high as you can on a time limit), others are mostly similar with a few added wrinkles that slightly change how it plays ("Bombing Run" in Waves plays much like RE2's "Pacifism", but with the added quirk of having to deliver a bomb to a specific point on the map before the bomb detontates on yourself, losing a life in the process). Meanwhile the "Chase" and "Rush" modes in Waves not like any modes in Retro Evolved 2 (funnily enough, the only mode in RE2 that Waves doesn't have an equivalent for is, in fact, called "Waves").

Sadly, Retro Evolved 2 isn't available on PC. I don't feel too terribly sad about that, however, as Waves is a fantastic alternative. I can totally respect a developer who decides that they want to make a game that's *ahem* "heavily inspired" by an existing title, but then they aspire to make it just as good or possibly even better than the game they're ripping off. 

Also, the soundtrack has a track in it that samples Kefka's iconic laugh from Final Fantasy VI. I just can't argue against something like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116582587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1498238598}
review:
I found this game in the suggest games that Steam put there for me. The name was what caught my attention. And I have to say that Steam did a REALLY good job by saying I might like this game, considering the ones that I already own. I absolutely love Waves. I bought it like an hour ago and already have over 3 million points! :D I'm thinking that's pretty good, but it might be terrible, I'm not sure.

I would not recommend this game to people who like a slow, thought out kind of gameplay. This is a fast paced type of game where you need really good reflexes and awareness. Your eyes have to be constantly searching and your fingers always moving. A lot of things are going on at once, like dozens of explosions, things flying everywhere, bright lights. Its pretty extreme!

There are multiple modes to play in (Survival being my personal favorite) and each is unique. The settings are great, you can change the keybindings to your liking and change to mouse sensitivity. The graphics are great and amazingly smooth. The aim seems perfect to me and I always like going into slomo to see my enemies explode. I find it a very pleasurable game and hate to exit it off. Just the fact that I have a high score makes me want to keep playing. And of course you HAVE to beat your friends' score, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561197985512939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1407907853}
review:
Holy heck this game is bad.  For starters, the graphics are too noisy.  After a minute or two of playing you can't tell enemies from powerups and not only does this cause deaths and frustration, but it's so blatantly trying to rip off of Geometry Wars that it's not even trying to hide how poorly it was handled.

The game is uninteresting, mechanics are beyond boring, and the scoring system is fundamentally flawed such that it favors luck over skill in almost every scenario.

Finally, the music and robotic voice are interesting at first but like the rest of the game, become annoying after the first few games.

Save yourself the time and frustration and play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993363806', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1428386638}
review: The heir to the Geometry Wars throne. Basically perfect. A combo mechanic ensures that the game is always scaling to just beyond your comfort zone. The better you do, the harder the game gets and the more points you score. A fine example of really polished arcade game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043157999', 'num_games_owned': 2025, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1701321321}
review: Addictive as hell. I always end up playing longer than I meant to. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198032047391', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1656008346}
review:
Oh that music!

This game is a great time killer. I can see it taking up a tyon of down time, and I hear an android version is in the works as well as special maps?  

The tunes are from an artist named Smiletron. Most of his stuff is free but i still bought the sound track to support him and the dev team for wave.
I caought this game on sale and it was worth every penny, it is even worth the 5 it costs when im writing this rev.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986962007', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1666400498}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023894006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1662769413}
review: If you like Geometry Wars, you will like this game.  The best part, to me, is that there are multiple game modes to help keep the game fresh.  I highly recommend playing this game, even if you haven't gotten into the two-stick-shooters yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028372790', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1463373107}
review: Un bon petit jeu qui permet de passer le temps, TrÃ¨s jolie Ã  regarder, mais les musiques sont rÃ©pÃ©titives car peu nombreuses ( 3 / 4 ) mais ce serait bouder un quelque chose qui mÃ©rite de l'attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032835217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1668161659}

author: {'steamid': '76561198136576294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1619955336}
review:
This game is similar to most other twin stickers, yet waves makes it look really good while doing it.  It's visually very pleasing, and Waves also has a pretty decent soundtrack.  Waves isn't reinventing the wheel, but it does over some original game types, 6 or 7 in total.   

Ive purchased it at $1.99, and have seen it at the price several times, it's every bit of worth that price.  It's usually $5, I believe.  After playing it, I would have spent the $5.

Rating based on Gameplay and Replayability. 8.2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063835826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1416797406}
review: Basically Geometry wars retro evolved meets an elite upgrade. This is the most addictive game I have played in a while. The score board keeps you coming back for more. Chill playing this or take it seriously. Either way. Completely worth the price. 100% Legit. Though you might not enjoy it unless you have a controller. It's not really meant to be played with a Keyboard/mouse. You 'can' play with such but.... I strongly recommend a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050507674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1579862055}
review: This game is sexy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984320376', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1450305639}
review: Waves comes through 100% for a game in the Twin-Stick Shooter genere. Music is great, visuals are great, and the various game modes and degree of challenge is on par for what you'd expect from these types of games. This one goes right up there with the classics like Geometry Wars and its sequel. Worth the buy, especially if its one sale! 5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198025343532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1498992538}
review:
Waves is an awesome fast paced 'arcade' style shooter that for the price is an absolute steal! This game is incredibly addictive, has great graphics and colours, a great selection of different modes from survival to bomb run and also has an amazing retro themed electronic soundtrack to go with it.

Add this all together and you get a great addictive game that you will play for a long time to come, as these types of games don't really get old.. ever! 

Would highly recommend and for the price it is 100% worth it! I would give it 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143223512', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 3799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1537095603}
review:
Simples mas nÃ£o simplÃ³rio, frenÃ©tico e colorido, waves Ã© um bastante arcade perfeito pra vc que curtiu asteroides, mas com muito mais luz, mais cores e uma trilha sonora super bem encaixada. Apesar de poder ser jogado com teclado e mouse,
waves Ã© um jogo que proporciona uma experiencia mais legal com o joypad.

Com o bastao esquerdo vc movimenta a bola no ring, com o bastÃ£o direito vc atira e direciona os disparos podendo atirar em uma determinada direÃ§Ã£o e mover-se livremente ao mesmo tempo. Com um gatilho do lado direito vc usa o buffer que Ã© um slow motion curto que recarrega com alguns segundos. Com o gatilho esquerdo vc dispara as bombas que sÃ³ podem ser usadas quando vc acumula um combo de 10 hits e ficam disponÃ­veis por algo como 3 segundos.

Isso torna o jogo bastante difÃ­cil e variado na medida em que vc sobe em niveis.

Waves conta com 7 modos de jogo e uma tabela de scores pra cada modo.  Durante toda partida vc ve do lado direito o primeiro colocado do score para o modo q vc joga no momento. E cada modo Ã© bastante particular

o primeiro Ã© o time crush, durante 3 minutos, com  vidas infinitas, vc deve acumular o maximo de
pontos que puder

o segundo Ã© o survival no qual nÃ£o ha contagem de tempo e vc possui 3 vidas, podendo ganhar vidas extras ao longo da
partida

o terceiro Ã© rush onde voce comeÃ§a a partida com um minto e meio de tempo e vidas ilimitadas, mas vc perde 10 segundos
a cada vez q perde a bola. podendo ganhar 10 segundos toda vez q subir de nÃ­vel.

quarto: Bombing run,  vocÃª perde o poder de atirar podendo  continuar usando o slow motion e uma funÃ§Ã£o para dar um knock back objetos ao redor. o jogador deve se manter em constante movimento tocando nos icones vermelhos, q sÃ£o as bombas para eliminar os objetos da tela.

quinto: Ã© o chalenge, vocÃª conta com trÃªs vidas para passar por uma sÃ©rie de desafios especificos

sexto: chase, vocÃª pode atirar mas deve manter a bola em constante movimento passando pelos
icones vermlehos tendo 4 segundos para tocar o proximos icone vermelhos

o ultimo Ã© o Hold, um novo elemento aparece, um circulo de luz que se move pela arena aleatoriamente
o jogador pode rolar para fora do circulo mas sÃ³ pode atirar desde que esteja dentro do circulo 

o estilo de Waves convinda vocÃª para um desafio colorido e danÃ§ante. garantindo diversÃ£o para uma ou mais pessoas

experimente Waves, 2011, da Squid In a Box
baixando gratuitamente o demo na steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015399925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1577238681}
review: [b]Waves[/b] plays like an arcade game with the intensity of an FPS. There's nothing more satisfying than narrowly avoiding that one enemy or when you first break a score of 10 million. The different game modes keep it uniquely challenging and fresh for a really long time. My personal favorite modes are Survival and Bombing Run, which both keep your heart pounding until that heartbreaking moment when you inevitably explode. The soundtrack is amazing and brings an additional layer of awesomeness to an already great game. 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083995757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1406312409}
review:
Ein wirkliches gutes Gelegenheitsspiel zu kleinem Preis.

Berherzigt alles was ein gutes Spiel benÃ¶tigt. Simpes Spielprinzip, einfacher Einstieg, nicht unfair ansteigender Schwierigkeitsgrad, unterschiedliche Gegnertypen (Bewegungsmuster) und es motiviert allein durch das Gameplay. Dazu noch verschiedene Spielmodi mit sehr guten Ideen zur Abwechslung.

Allerdings wirklich nur ein Gelegenheitsspiel das man zwischendurch fÃ¼r 30 Minuten oder eine Stunde spielt.

Kleiner Tipp: Sobald sich sehr viele Gegner auf dem Monitor bewegen unbedingt die Slow Motion Funktion benutzen.^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198015835461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1645360680}
review: very funny

Le principe : Tuer un maximum d'ennemis tout en esquivant ceux-ci. La petite boule jouable fait penser Ã  la forme boule de Samus (Metroid).

author: {'steamid': '76561198046112335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1517104352}
review: If you like twin stick shooters this game is a must buy. It's my favorite TSS (I use KB & Mouse) that I've played. I enjoyed it more than the PS3's Super Stardust. It's very addicting! Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039868153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1440898984}
review: This is a very cute game and a good way to spend a few hours. It's got a fantastic soundtrack and is very fun to play for a while. I got tired of it before too long but it's certainly worth a few dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034172959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1517107859}
review: Waves is a highly entertaining top-down twin-stick shooter. With its retro aesthetic and its frenetic pace combined with a tight gameplay, Waves provides a great arena shooter experience. There is a decent number of modes with interesting rules, and also a good electronic musical score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125538770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1405857912}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065656866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1556975730}
review: highly reommend grait fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198091811243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1650880145}
review: The graphics and sound are great in that they aren't overly much to distract you but at the same time gives that little extra to the game to make it more... physically attractive. The actual gameplay is fun and adicting, easily able to be picked up at random if you're bored (or whish to procrastinate)  and you won't get "burned out" and bored from playing it a lot either. Imagine Geometry Wars, but more spherical, hexagonal, 3-D, and musical, it also feels more modern/up-to-date than GW. Fun arcade game, worth the small bit of money, and the music is really nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960478145', 'num_games_owned': 2349, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1542808760}
review: Nice brainless twinstick shooter with extremely flashy visuals. I had no idea I was into chiptunes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025091679', 'num_games_owned': 2328, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1507996525}
review:
This is one of the better games on Steam, it's so very simple yet addictive and good-looking that you just can't stop mashing the buttons. Such colors, very eye candy, wow. Unlike many 2,5 dimensional shooters which are repetitive and uninteresting, Waves is totally awesome like a zombie ninja Jesus riding a motorcycle into outer space.

Playing Waves is very easy, but getting good at it is next to impossible. Needs good eye-hand coordination and swift reflexes. The game gets FAST in a minute or two, and that's an old school definition of FAST, where 0,05 second gap really matters and a slightest error kills you instantly. TO DEATH. Like, really.

Just go ahead and buy it right now. This game is good, and you should feel good about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971150993', 'num_games_owned': 906, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1405014720}
review: Pretty and manic, it's essentially Geometry Wars with a slow-motion button, but that's not a bad thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118428679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1409801706}
review:
Fast gameplay! Upbeat music! Seizure-inducing lights!
Fans of the Xbox Live Arcade hit, "Geometry Wars" will LOVE this game!
There are multiple modes to enjoy, leaderboards so you can compete against your friends, and even controller support!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043399118', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1414557721}
review: If you loved any of the Geometry Wars games, then you'll want to try this one out! The only downpart of this game is it lacks multiplayer.. :\

author: {'steamid': '76561197996899722', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1404428636}
review:
I don't think I have the reaction times to play this properly. :).  I really enjoy playing Waves.  It's visually stunning, and the music is fantastic.     The choices of games to play is pretty good, and the game rewards the tactical player who looks ahead to see what the next step will be, thereby chaining their moves for bigger and bigger multipliers.  

Watching a ripple of destruction echo outwards from the epicenter of your bomb, or taking out a cloud of incoming bogeys with a well-placed storm of bullets is great.     The game can be frustrating at times.  It's a dual-stick game, so it's very easy to momentarily fumble a direction of movement with a direction of firing.   

The only downside is that the last time I tried to play it, it crashed on Windows.  No other games crash. Some update must have broken it.  I've reinstalled, to no avail, so it's getting uninstalled :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198021130943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1659753910}
review: I always start to play without the intention of going on too long. That never happens and I end up trying to beat my high score for quite longer than I expected. It has smooth controls, glitzy graphics and a pulsing soundtrack(with one really really great song on there).

review: Good old arcade style game with good music. If you liked Geomatry Wars, you wil like this. Just a shame that these type of games dont have levels or a goal to work towards other then high scores. But other then that, its very adictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059666767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1635012117}
review: At first I was addicted to this game due to its similarities to Geometry Wars, but I really like this game more as the waves become much more intense, the games modes are more diverse and interesting to play, and the kill-threshold bomb is really awesome when you get it going. The one dispute I have about this game, is the way they implemented one achievement. The idea in a game like this one is to get your score as high as possible right? Wrong. In this game the score maxes out at 2.1 billion and you get an achievement but THE COUNTER STOPS GOING. That is a horrible, game-breaking thing to do to an old-school styled arcade shooter. YOU PUT A FUCKING CAP ON THE SCORE YOU RUINED THE GAME FOR ME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052399922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1707675947}
review: Lots of fun! I can't believe how immersed I could get in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051372395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1542727905}
review: Graphically pleasing, fun gameplay, good music, and entertaining game modes. I recommend this game, especially if you have an XBox 360 controller to play it with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071445821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1567963219}
review: This is one of the nicer dual-stick arcade shooters I've played. It has a relaxed vibe despite all the chaos on-screen, and the many different modes ensure that you'll find at least one way to play that suits you. The concept and execution are great; it's only a shame that due to engine licensing, this game didn't see a release on GNU/Linux. I recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed Beat Hazard or Geometry Wars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979186288', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1415514468}
review: I had some problems with actually running the game at first. It would crash as the game attempted to boot up everytime BUT, the forums had the problem solved already and I just needed to download an updated Physx driver of some sort. This game is addicting, colorful, twitchy, but also relaxing. I could easily vibe out to this game for extended durations. It kind of reminds me of Geometry Wars on steroids. More variety and challenges to pick from along with exceptional twin stick arcade fun. A must play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053471678', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1438526572}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033989564', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1407789450}
review: A perfectly formed shoot them up, novel in its execution. Perfect for lunchtime spot of zen destruction, or late night andrenaline jolts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028049202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1403650884}
review:
I recommend this to anyone who enjoyed Geometry Wars. The gameplay and graphics are very similar.

The scoring and combo system took me a while to get used to, but once I did, it was pretty fun. 
Perhaps some more effective tutorials would help ease players into the mechanics.

My only real complaint is that gameplay sessions lasted a bit too long. Geometry Wars was fun because the sessions were short, and you always wanted to play "one more time!". Here you get a bit too many lives.

But still, a fun experience overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134539767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1430168342}
review: Very nice, very much in the same vein as Geometry Wars, This has a little more replayability with various game types available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042978859', 'num_games_owned': 1225, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1652049037}
review:
